prior_works.title: AdWords and Generalized Online Matching
prior_works.authors: Aranyak Mehta, Amin Saberi, Umesh Vazirani, Vijay Vazirani
prior_works.role: Foundational model and technique for online budgeted allocation via primal–dual/water-filling style algorithms.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The paper’s online resource-allocation setting and its use of distribution-aware, capacity-respecting policies build directly on the AdWords/online allocation framework, extending it with equity constraints and ex-ante/ex-post guarantees.

prior_works.title: Online Stochastic Matching: Beating 1−1/e
prior_works.authors: Jon Feldman, Nikhil Korula, Vahab Mirrokni, Cliff Stein
prior_works.role: Introduced i.i.d./stochastic arrival models and ex-ante analysis for online allocation/matching.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The work’s reliance on known arrival distributions and ex-ante performance baselines for designing online policies directly follows the stochastic matching paradigm, which this paper augments with equity objectives.

prior_works.title: Fast Algorithms for Online Stochastic Convex Programming
prior_works.role: General framework for solving online allocation as stochastic convex programs using primal-dual updates with distributional knowledge.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The paper operationalizes equity by casting proportional-share goals as convex constraints/objectives within a stochastic online optimization framework inspired by Agrawal–Devanur.

prior_works.title: Dominant Resource Fairness: Fair allocation of multiple resource types
prior_works.authors: Ali Ghodsi, Matei Zaharia, Benjamin Hindman, Andy Konwinski, Scott Shenker, Ion Stoica
prior_works.role: Canonical fairness-by-demand principle for resource allocation (equalizing dominant shares).
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The external equity notion—ensuring allocations proportional to heterogeneous demands—draws directly on DRF-style fairness-by-demand ideas, adapted here to sequential arrivals and stochastic guarantees.

prior_works.title: Rate control for communication networks: shadow prices, proportional fairness and stability
prior_works.authors: Frank P. Kelly, Aman K. Maulloo, David K. H. Tan
prior_works.role: Introduced proportional fairness and the use of convex-analytic methods for equitable resource sharing.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The paper’s proportional-share equity targets and their convex formulation are conceptually grounded in proportional fairness, extended to online and group-constrained settings.

prior_works.title: Fairness in Learning: Classic and Contextual Bandits
prior_works.authors: Matthew Joseph, Michael Kearns, Jamie Morgenstern, Aaron Roth
prior_works.role: Sequential decision-making with explicit fairness constraints and distinctions between ex-ante and realized notions of fairness.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The ex-ante/ex-post equity metrics in an online, sequential environment are informed by fairness-in-bandits formulations, which this paper repurposes for resource allocation rather than arm selection.

prior_works.title: A Reductions Approach to Fair Classification
prior_works.authors: Alekh Agarwal, Alina Beygelzimer, Miroslav Dudík, John Langford, Hanna Wallach
prior_works.role: Optimization-based framework for enforcing group-parity constraints (e.g., demographic parity) via convex surrogates.
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The internal equity model’s requirement that allocations track group proportions mirrors demographic-parity style constraints and motivates treating fairness as convex constraints inside an online optimizer.

synthesis_narrative:
This paper fuses two mature lines of work—online resource allocation and formal fairness—to define and solve equity-driven allocation with sequential arrivals under distributional models. From the online allocation side, AdWords-style primal–dual methods and stochastic arrival models (Mehta et al.; Feldman et al.) supply the canonical setting: resources with capacities, heterogeneous agents, and ex-ante analysis relative to a stochastic benchmark. Agrawal–Devanur’s online stochastic convex programming provides the technical playbook for embedding additional structure—here, equity constraints—into distribution-aware primal–dual updates with concentration-based ex-post control.
On the fairness side, the external equity requirement (proportional-to-demand guarantees across arrival times) traces to proportional fairness and DRF: Kelly et al. establish convex formulations of proportional sharing, while DRF crystallizes fairness-by-demand in multi-resource environments; this paper adapts these principles to dynamic, stochastic arrivals and proves guarantees both in expectation (ex-ante) and on realized sequences (ex-post). The internal equity model maps group-level fairness to allocation: bandit fairness (Joseph et al.) clarifies ex-ante vs ex-post fairness in sequential decisions, and fair classification via reduction (Agarwal et al.) motivates implementing demographic-parity-like constraints as convex conditions that an online allocator can track. Together, these works enable the paper’s core contribution: principled online policies that achieve equitable resource shares proportional to demands or group prevalence, with rigorous ex-ante and ex-post guarantees under realistic stochastic arrival assumptions.
